Original Translation: "So don't worry. Don't say, 'What will we eat?' Or, 'What will we drink?' Or, 'What will we wear?'
Translated Sentence: So, all of us are always thinking, "What are we going to eat?" or "What are we going to drink?" or "What are we going to wear?"

Original: راه حتى اللي ما كيعرفوش الله كيطلبو ݣاع هادشي، وباكم اللي فالسما كيعرف بلي نتم محتاجين لهادشي كله.
Original Translation: People who are ungodly run after all of those things. Your Father who is in heaven knows that you need them.
Translated Sentence: For even the Gentiles ask for these things, and those in heaven know that you need these things.

Original: ولكن قلبو فاللول على مملكة الله والمراد دياله، وهادشي كله غيتزاد ليكم.
Original Translation: "But put God's kingdom first. Do what he wants you to do. Then all of those things will also be given to you.
Translated Sentence: But seek first the kingdom of God and his will, and all these things will be added to you.

Original: وما ترفدوش الهم للنهار اللي جاي، خلي هم غدا لغدا. وكل نهار بركا عليه غير همه».
Original Translation: "So don't worry about tomorrow. Tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
Translated Sentence: Don't keep them for the next day, keep them for tomorrow. Every day is a good day.

Original: الفصل السابع ما تحكمو على حد
Original Translation: Be Fair When You Judge Others
Translated Sentence: Chapter seven is not judged at all

Original: «ما تحكمو على حد، باش ما يتحكمش عليكم.
Original Translation: "Do not judge others. Then you will not be judged.
Translated Sentence: "Do not judge, or you will not be judged.

Original: حيت الحكام باش كتحكمو، بيه غيتحكم عليكم، والعبار باش كتعبرو، بيه غيتعبر ليكم. مرقس
Original Translation: You will be judged in the same way you judge others. You will be measured in the same way you measure others.
Translated Sentence: For by what you judge, you will be judged; by what you speak, you will be judged.

Original: علاش كتشوف الخشة ديال التبن اللي فعين خوك، وما كتردش البال للعود اللي فعينك؟
Original Translation: "You look at the bit of sawdust in your friend's eye. But you pay no attention to the piece of wood in your own eye.
Translated Sentence: Why do you see the eye of the beetle in your eye and not look back at your eye?

Original: ولا كيفاش غادي تݣول لخوك خليني نحيد الخشة ديال التبن من عينك، وعينك نت فيها عود؟
Original Translation: How can you say to your friend, 'Let me take the bit of sawdust out of your eye'? How can you say this while there is a piece of wood in your own eye?
Translated Sentence: Or how would you tell your brother to let me take the straw from your eye, when your eye is covered with wood?

Original: آ هاد المنافق، حيد بعد فاللول العود من عينك، ديك الساعة غتشوف مزيان باش تحيد الخشة ديال التبن من عين خوك.
Original Translation: "You pretender! First take the piece of wood out of your own eye. Then you will be able to see clearly to take the bit of sawdust out of your friend's eye.
Translated Sentence: You hypocrite , if you are still in your first eye, you will see a good way to remove the needle from your pig 's eye.

Original: ما تعطيوش الحاجة المقدسة للكلاب لا يضورو فيكم ويقطعوكم، وما ترميوش الجوهر ديالكم للحلالف لا يعفسو عليه برجليهم». طلبو، قلبو ودقو
Original Translation: "Do not give holy things to dogs. Do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they might walk all over them. Then they might turn around and tear you to pieces. Ask, Search, Knock
Translated Sentence: Do not give the sacred need to dogs lest they spoil you and cut you off, nor cast your jewels at the curse of the curse. Ask, be careful and be careful.

Original: «طلبو وغتاخدو. قلبو وغتلقاو. دقو الباب وغيتحل ليكم.
Original Translation: "Ask, and it will be given to you. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will be opened to you.
Translated Sentence: Ask and you will receive. He will open and you will find. Knock and you will be opened.

Original: راه ݣاع اللي طلب غيتعطى ليه، واللي قلب غيلقا، واللي دق الباب غيتحل ليه.
Original Translation: Everyone who asks will receive. He who searches will find. The door will be opened to the one who knocks.
Translated Sentence: Everything he asks will be given to him , and the heart is closed , and the door is opened to him.

Original: شكون فيكم اللي إلا طلب منه ولده الخبز غيعطيه حجرة،
Original Translation: "Suppose your son asks for bread. Which of you will give him a stone?
Translated Sentence: "Which of you, if his son asks for bread, will give him a manger?

Original: ولا إلا طلب منه حوتة غيعطيه لفعى؟
Original Translation: Or suppose he asks for a fish. Which of you will give him a snake?
Translated Sentence: Or if he asks for a fish , will he give it to a snake ?

Original: إيوا، إلا كنتو نتم اللي ما مزيانينش كتعرفو تعطيو لولادكم الحوايج المزيانين، كيفاش باكم اللي فالسما ما يعطيش الحوايج المزيانين لهادوك اللي كيطلبوه؟
Original Translation: Even though you are evil, you know how to give good gifts to your children. How much more will your Father who is in heaven give good gifts to those who ask him!
Translated Sentence: Yes , if you are the ones who don 't know how to give your children the best jewelry , how many in heaven don 't give the best jewelry to those who ask for it ?

Original: كما كتبغيو الناس يديرو معاكم، هكا خاصكم حتى نتم تديرو معاهم، حيت على هادشي كيضور تعليم الشرع والأنبيا». لوقا 6‏:31 الباب الضيق
Original Translation: "In everything, do to others what you would want them to do to you. This is what is written in the Law and in the Prophets. The Large and Small Gates
Translated Sentence: Just as you want men to do to you, do so to them, for this is the whole law and the prophets.

Original: «دخلو من الباب الضيق، حيت الباب اللي كيدي للهلاك واسع وطريقه ساهلة، وكتار اللي كيدخلو منه.
Original Translation: "Enter God's kingdom through the narrow gate. The gate is large and the road is wide that lead to death and hell. Many people go that way.
Translated Sentence: "Enter through the narrow gate. For wide is the gate and easy is the way that leads to destruction, and many are the ones who enter through it.

Original: شحال مضيق الباب وشحال واعرة الطريق اللي كتدي للحياة، وقلال اللي كيلقاوها». الشجرة كتعرف من غلتها
Original Translation: But the gate is small and the road is narrow that lead to life. Only a few people find it. A Tree and Its Fruit
Translated Sentence: How narrow the door, how narrow the road to life, and how few they find. A tree knows its own root

Original: «ردو بالكم من الأنبيا الكدابين، اللي كيجيو عندكم لابسين لباس الخرفان ولكن هم من لداخل دياب خطافا.
Original Translation: "Watch out for false prophets. They come to you pretending to be sheep. But on the inside they are hungry wolves.
Translated Sentence: "Take heed to the false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but are in sheep's clothing.

Original: راه من غلتهم تعرفوهم. واش تقدرو تجنيو العنب من الشوك، ولا الكرموس من السدرة؟
Original Translation: You can tell what they really are by what they do.  "Do people pick grapes from bushes? Do they pick figs from thorns?
Translated Sentence: It is very difficult to know them . Can you make grapes from thorns or raisins from seedlings ?

Original: وهكا كل شجرة مزيانة كتعطي غلة مزيانة، وكل شجرة خايبة كتعطي غلة خايبة.
Original Translation: In the same way, every good tree bears good fruit. But a bad tree bears bad fruit.
Translated Sentence: Thus every good tree produces good fruit, and every bad tree produces bad fruit.

Original: والشجرة المزيانة ما يمكنش تعطي غلة خايبة، والشجرة الخايبة ما يمكنش تعطي غلة مزيانة.
Original Translation: A good tree can't bear bad fruit. And a bad tree can't bear good fruit.
Translated Sentence: A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, and a bad tree cannot bear good fruit.

Original: كل شجرة ما كتعطيش غلة مزيانة كتقطع وكترمى فالعافية. متى
Original Translation: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down. It is thrown into the fire.
Translated Sentence: Not every tree produces good fruit when it is cut down and thrown into the ground.

Original: وهكا من غلتهم تعرفوهم». متى 12‏:33 خاصنا نديرو مراد الله
Original Translation: You can tell each tree by its fruit.
Translated Sentence: And so you know them. Matthew 12:33 We must worship God

Original: «ماشي ݣاع اللي كيݣول لي: آ سيدي، آ سيدي! غادي يدخل لمملكة السماوات، ولكن اللي كيدخل ليها هو اللي كيدير مراد با اللي فالسماوات.
Original Translation: "Not everyone who says to me, 'Lord, Lord,' will enter the kingdom of heaven. Only those who do what my Father in heaven wants will enter.
Translated Sentence: Not everyone who says to me, 'Lord, Lord,' will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only those who do so will.

Original: فداك النهار، بزاف اللي غادي يݣولو لي: آ سيدي، آ سيدي! واش ماشي بإسمك تنبأنا؟ وبإسمك خرجنا الجنون؟ وبإسمك درنا معجزات كتار؟
Original Translation: "Many will say to me on that day, 'Lord! Lord! Didn't we prophesy in your name? Didn't we drive out demons in your name? Didn't we do many miracles in your name?'
Translated Sentence: That day , many will say to me: "Sir , sir ! Is not your name a prophecy ? Is not your name a madness ? Is it your name that we have performed so many miracles ? "

Original: فديك الساعة غادي نݣول ليهم: عمرني ما عرفتكم! بعدو مني آ المدنبين!. المتال ديال جوج ديور
Original Translation: Then I will tell them clearly, 'I never knew you. Get away from me, you who do evil!' The Wise and Foolish Builders
Translated Sentence: At that time I will say to them: "Give me the first time I knew you! Follow me, you two-door metal!

Original: راه ݣاع اللي كيسمع كلامي وكيدير بيه، كيشبه لواحد الراجل بعقله بنى داره على الصخر.
Original Translation: "So then, everyone who hears my words and puts them into practice is like a wise man. He builds his house on the rock.
Translated Sentence: Everyone who listens to me and cares about me is like a man with a mind that builds on rock.

Original: ومنين طاحت الشتا وفاضو الويدان، وجات ريح قوية وضربات ديك الدار، ما رابتش، حيت الساس ديالها كان مبني على الصخر.
Original Translation: The rain comes down. The water rises. The winds blow and beat against that house. But it does not fall. It is built on the rock.
Translated Sentence: When the cold and winds were low, there was a strong wind and the house was hit, but it didn't work, because the foundation was built on rock.

Original: وݣاع اللي كيسمع هاد الكلام ديالي وما كيديرش بيه، راه كيشبه لواحد الراجل حمق بنى داره على الرملة.
Original Translation: "But everyone who hears my words and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man. He builds his house on sand.
Translated Sentence: And anyone who hears these words and doesn't do them is like a fool who built his house on sand.

Original: ومنين طاحت الشتا وفاضو الويدان، وجات ريح قوية وضربات ديك الدار، رابت وكان الترياب ديالها قوي».
Original Translation: The rain comes down. The water rises. The winds blow and beat against that house. And it falls with a loud crash."
Translated Sentence: When the cold and winds were low, there was a strong wind and the house was hit, and the weather was very strong.

Original: وملي كمل يسوع هاد الكلام، تعجبو جماعات الناس من التعليم دياله، مرقس
Original Translation: Jesus finished saying all these things. The crowds were amazed at his teaching.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus finished these words, the crowds were amazed at his teaching.

Original: حيت كان كيعلمهم بحال شي واحد عنده السلطة، ماشي بحال العلما د الشرع ديالهم.
Original Translation: He taught like one who had authority. He did not speak like their teachers of the law.
Translated Sentence: Because it taught them how someone else had authority, not so much as their law student.

Original: الفصل التامن يسوع كيشافي راجل مجدام
Original Translation: Jesus Heals a Man Who Had a Skin Disease
Translated Sentence: Chapter eight Jesus heals a man with a broken heart

Original: وملي نزل يسوع من الجبل، تبعوه بزاف د الجماعات ديال الناس.
Original Translation: Jesus came down from the mountainside. Large crowds followed him.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus came down from the mountain , large crowds followed him.

Original: وقرب لعنده واحد المجدام، وسجد ليه وݣال: «آ سيدي، إلا بغيتي، راك تقدر تردني طاهر».
Original Translation: A man who had a skin disease came and got down on his knees in front of Jesus. He said, "Lord, if you are willing to make me 'clean,' you can do it."
Translated Sentence: A paralytic came to him and fell down before him and said, "Sir, if you want to, you can make me clean".

Original: وهو يمد يسوع يده ومسه وݣال: «أنا بغيت إيوا كون طاهر!». وفديك الساعة تحيد منه الجدام وولى طاهر.
Original Translation: Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. "I am willing to do it," he said. "Be 'clean'!"  Right away the man was healed of his skin disease.
Translated Sentence: Jesus reached out his hand and touched him. "I want you to be clean, " he said". In a few hours you will be clean".

Original: وݣال ليه يسوع: «رد بالك باش ما تݣولها لحتى شي حد، ولكن سير ووري داتك لراجل الدين، وعطي الهدية اللي وصى بيها موسى، باش يكون هادشي شهادة ليهم». الخدام ديال القايد د العسكر كيتشافى
Original Translation: Then Jesus said to him, "Don't tell anyone. Go and show yourself to the priest. Offer the gift Moses commanded. It will be a witness to them." A Roman Commander Has Faith
Translated Sentence: Jesus said to him, "Watch out that you do not tell anyone. Go, show yourself to the priest and give the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them".

Original: وملي دخل يسوع لكفرناحوم، جا لعنده واحد القايد د العسكر كيرغبه،
Original Translation: When Jesus entered Capernaum, a Roman commander came to him. He asked Jesus for help.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus entered Capernaum , there was a certain commander of the army who approached him,

Original: وݣال ليه: «آ سيدي، الخدام ديالي فالدار طايح فالفراش مشلول وكيتعدب بزاف».
Original Translation: "Lord," he said, "my servant lies at home and can't move. He is suffering terribly."
Translated Sentence: He said: "Yes sir , my servant is paralyzed and is very tired in bed.

Original: وهو يݣول ليه يسوع: «هاني غادي نمشي باش نشافيه».
Original Translation: Jesus said, "I will go and heal him."
Translated Sentence: "I am going to heal him, " Jesus replied.

Original: وجاوبه القايد د العسكر: «أنا ما نستاهلش آ سيدي تدخل تحت سقف داري، ولكن ݣول غير كلمة وحدة والخدام ديالي غيتشافى.
Original Translation: The commander replied, "Lord, I am not good enough to have you come into my house. But just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
Translated Sentence: The commander replied: "I am not worthy, sir, to enter under my roof, but if I say one word and my service is cured".

Original: حيت حتى أنا كاين اللي كيحكم في وعندي عسكر كنحكم فيه، كنݣول لهادا: سير! وكيمشي، وكنݣول للاخر: أجي! وكيجي، وكنݣول للعبد ديالي: دير هادي! وكيديرها».
Original Translation: I myself am a man under authority. And I have soldiers who obey my orders. I tell this one, 'Go,' and he goes. I tell that one, 'Come,' and he comes. I say to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it."
Translated Sentence: For even I am a man under authority and have soldiers under me. If I say to one, 'Go,' he goes; if I say to another, 'Come,' he comes; if I say to my servant, 'Do this,' he does it.

Original: وملي سمعه يسوع تعجب وݣال لهادوك اللي تابعينه: «نݣول ليكم الحق: ما لقيت حتى شي واحد فإسرائيل عنده إيمان قوي بحال هادا.
Original Translation: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. He said to those following him, "What I'm about to tell you is true. In Israel I have not found anyone whose faith is so strong.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed and said to those who followed him, "I tell you the truth, I have not found anyone in Israel who has such great faith.

Original: وراني نݣول ليكم بلي بزاف د الناس غادي يجيو من الشرق والغرب ويݣلسو ياكلو مع إبراهيم وإسحاق ويعقوب فمملكة السماوات. لوقا
Original Translation: "I say to you that many will come from the east and the west. They will take their places at the feast in the kingdom of heaven. They will sit with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
Translated Sentence: I tell you, many will come from the east and west and will sit down at the feast with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.

Original: أما هادوك اللي كان خاصهم يكونو فالمملكة، غيترماو على برا فالضلمة، تم فين غيكون البكا وتغزاز السنان». متى
Original Translation: But those who think they belong to the kingdom will be thrown outside, into the darkness. There they will sob and grind their teeth."
Translated Sentence: Those who were to be in the kingdom were thrown out into the darkness, where the weeping and the gnashing of teeth were to take place.

Original: ومن بعد، ݣال يسوع للقايد د العسكر: «سير! على قد الإيمان ديالك، غادي يكون ليك داكشي اللي بغيتي». وفديك الساعة نيت تشافى الخدام دياله. يسوع كيشافي نسيبة بطرس وبزاف د الناس
Original Translation: Then Jesus said to the Roman commander, "Go! It will be done just as you believed it would."  And his servant was healed at that very hour. Jesus Heals Many People
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus said to the centurion, "Go! According to your faith, it will be done for you. " And immediately his wives and many others were healed.

Original: وملي دخل يسوع لدار بطرس، لقا نسيبة بطرس طايحة فالفراش حيت فيها السخانة.
Original Translation: When Jesus came into Peter's house, he saw Peter's mother-in-law. She was lying in bed. She had a fever.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus came to Peter's house, he found Peter's sister-in-law lying in bed with a fever.

Original: ومس يسوع يدها، وهي تمشي منها السخانة، وناضت وضايفته.
Original Translation: Jesus touched her hand, and the fever left her. She got up and began to wait on him.
Translated Sentence: Jesus touched her hand , and the fever left her , and she greeted him.

Original: وملي وصلات العشية، جابو ليه بزاف د الناس مسكونين بالجنون، وخرج الجنون بكلمة منه، وشفى ݣاع المرضى.
Original Translation: When evening came, many people controlled by demons were brought to Jesus. He drove out the spirits with a word. He healed all who were sick.
Translated Sentence: When the evening came, he was contacted by a crowd of mad people, and madness came through with a word, and all the patients were healed.

Original: وهكا تحقق الكلام اللي ݣال النبي إشعيا: «هو اللي خدا وجعنا وهز مرضنا». كيفاش خاص يكونو هادوك اللي كيتبعو يسوع
Original Translation: He did it to make what the prophet Isaiah had said come true. He had said, "He suffered the things we should have suffered.  He took on himself the sicknesses that should have been ours." (Isaiah 53:4) It Costs to Follow Jesus
Translated Sentence: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah: "He has taken our sickness and carried our diseases. How then will those who follow him be?"

Original: وملي شاف يسوع الجماعة د الناس ضايرين بيه، آمر التلامد دياله باش يقطعو للجهة لخرى ديال البحر.
Original Translation: Jesus saw the crowd around him. So he gave his disciples orders to go to the other side of the Sea of Galilee.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus saw the crowd surrounding him , he ordered his disciples to cross over to the other side of the lake.

Original: وهو يقرب لعنده واحد من العلما د الشرع وݣال ليه: «آ سيدي، غادي نتبعك فين ما مشيتي».
Original Translation: Then a teacher of the law came to him. He said, "Teacher, I will follow you no matter where you go."
Translated Sentence: He approached one of the law clerks and said: "Yes sir, I will follow you wherever you go".

Original: وجاوبه يسوع وݣال: «التعالب عندها غيرانها، وطيور السما عندها عشاشها، ولكن ولد الإنسان راه ما عنده حتى فين يسند راسه».
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "Foxes have holes. Birds of the air have nests. But the Son of Man has no place to lay his head."
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head".

Original: وݣال ليه واحد آخر من تلامده: «آ سيدي، خليني بعد نمشي ندفن با».
Original Translation: Another follower said to him, "Lord, first let me go and bury my father."
Translated Sentence: Another of his disciples said to him, "Sir, let me go and bury him first".

Original: ولكن يسوع جاوبه: «غير تبعني نت وخلي الموتى يدفنو الموتى ديالهم!». يسوع كيهدن واحد الرعدة
Original Translation: But Jesus told him, "Follow me. Let the dead bury their own dead." Jesus Calms the Storm
Translated Sentence: "Come, follow me, " Jesus replied", and let the dead bury their own dead".

Original: وملي ركب يسوع فالفلوكة، تبعوه تلامده.
Original Translation: Jesus got into a boat. His disciples followed him.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus got on the boat , his disciples followed him.

Original: وجات واحد الريح قوية بزاف فالبحر حتى عمرو الماج الفلوكة، وكان يسوع ناعس.
Original Translation: Suddenly a terrible storm came up on the lake. The waves crashed over the boat. But Jesus was sleeping.
Translated Sentence: A strong wind came up on the sea, and the crow was about to pass away. Jesus was asleep.

Original: وقربو لعنده تلامده وفيقوه وݣالو ليه: «عتقنا آ سيدي، راه حنا كنموتو!»،
Original Translation: The disciples went and woke him up. They said, "Lord! Save us! We're going to drown!"
Translated Sentence: The disciples came and woke him, saying, "Lord, we are about to die!"

Original: وهو يݣول ليهم: «مالكم خايفين آ هاد قلال الإيمان؟». ومن بعد، ناض ونهض فالريح والبحر، وهي تهدن الدنيا.
Original Translation: He replied, "Your faith is so small! Why are you so afraid?"  Then Jesus got up and ordered the winds and the waves to stop. It became completely calm.
Translated Sentence: He said to them, "Why are you afraid, you of little faith? " Then he rose and the winds and the sea moved, and the land was calm.

Original: وتعجبو الرجال وݣالو: «شكون هو هادا اللي حتى الريح والبحر كيطيعوه؟». يسوع كيخرج الجنون من جوج د الرجال من الجدريين
Original Translation: The disciples were amazed. They asked, "What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the waves obey him!" Jesus Heals Two Men Controlled by Demons
Translated Sentence: The men were amazed and asked, "Who is this man, that even the winds and the sea obey him?"

Original: وملي وصل يسوع للجهة لخرى من البحر حدا بلاد الجدريين، تلاقاو بيه جوج د الرجال مسكونين بالجنون خارجين من الروضة، وكانو خطر بزاف، حتى ما بقى حد قادر يدوز فديك الطريق.
Original Translation: Jesus arrived at the other side of the lake in the area of the Gadarenes. Two men controlled by demons met him. They came from the tombs. The men were so wild that no one could pass that way.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus crossed the sea to the land of the Gadarenians, he was met by two madmen outside the shelter, so dangerous that no one could walk in the way.

Original: وغير شافوه بداو كيغوتو وكيݣولو: «آش بينا وبينك آ ولد الله؟ واش جيتي لهنا باش تعدبنا قبل من الوقت؟».
Original Translation: "Son of God, what do you want with us?" they shouted. "Have you come here to punish us before the time for us to be judged?"
Translated Sentence: When they saw him, they began to cry out, "What have we to do with you, Son of God? Have you come here to preach to us before the appointed time?"

Original: وكانت واحد القطعة ديال الحلالف كبيرة سارحة فواحد الموضع قريب لتم،
Original Translation: Not very far away, a large herd of pigs was feeding.
Translated Sentence: One piece of a large, fast-moving shovel was nearby,

Original: ورغبو الجنون يسوع وݣالو ليه: «إلا خرجتينا، صيفطنا ندخلو فالقطعة ديال الحلالف».
Original Translation: The demons begged Jesus, "If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs."
Translated Sentence: The demons asked Jesus, "If you want to send us out, send us into the wilderness".

Original: وهو يݣول ليهم: «سيرو!» ومشاو دخلو فيها، وجرات القطعة كلها وطاحت من الحافة ديال الجبل للبحر وغرقات فالما.
Original Translation: Jesus said to them, "Go!"  So the demons came out of the men and went into the pigs. The whole herd rushed down the steep bank. They ran into the lake and drowned in the water.
Translated Sentence: He said to them, "Go!" And they went in, and the whole piece of the stone fell from the top of the mountain to the sea and sank in the sea.

Original: وهربو السراحا ومشاو للمدينة وخبرو بݣاع داكشي اللي جرا، وبداكشي اللي وقع للرجال اللي مسكونين بالجنون.
Original Translation: Those who were tending the pigs ran off. They went into the town and reported all this. They told the people what had happened to the men who had been controlled by demons.
Translated Sentence: They ran off and went into the city and told them all that had happened , including what happened to the madmen.

Original: وخرجو سكان المدينة كلهم باش يتلقاو ليسوع. وملي شافوه رغبوه يخرج من بلادهم.
Original Translation: Then the whole town went out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him to leave their area.
Translated Sentence: All the people of the city went out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they wanted him to leave their country.

Original: الفصل التاسع يسوع كيشافي مشلول
Original Translation: Jesus Heals a Man Who Could Not Walk
Translated Sentence: Chapter 9 Jesus healed a paralyzed man

Original: وركب يسوع فالفلوكة وقطع البحر ورجع لمدينته.
Original Translation: Jesus stepped into a boat. He went over to the other side of the lake and came to his own town.
Translated Sentence: Jesus got into the boat and crossed the sea and returned to his hometown.

Original: وجابو ليه شي ناس واحد الراجل مشلول ناعس فوق الفراش. وملي شاف يسوع إيمانهم ݣال للمشلول: «تيق آ ولدي، راه تغفرو ليك دنوبك».
Original Translation: Some men brought to him a man who could not walk. He was lying on a mat. Jesus saw that they had faith. So he said to the man, "Don't lose hope, son. Your sins are forgiven."
Translated Sentence: Then some people brought to him a paralytic lying on a bed. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, "Woe to me, son, your sins are forgiven you".

Original: وݣالو شي وحدين من العلما د الشرع فخاطرهم: «هاد الراجل كينطق بكلام الكفر!».
Original Translation: Then some teachers of the law said to themselves, "This fellow is saying a very evil thing!"
Translated Sentence: Some of the teachers of the law were saying, "This man blasphemes".

Original: وعرف يسوع فاش كيفكرو وݣال: «مالكم كتفكرو فحوايج خايبين فخاطركم؟
Original Translation: Jesus knew what they were thinking. So he said, "Why do you have evil thoughts in your hearts?
Translated Sentence: Jesus knew their thoughts and said, "What are you thinking about?

Original: أما سهل، يتݣال: مغفورين ليك دنوبك، ولا يتݣال: نوض وسير؟
Original Translation: Is it easier to say, 'Your sins are forgiven'? Or to say, 'Get up and walk'?
Translated Sentence: Or is it easier to say , ' I forgive you for your debt ' or , ' I walk ? '

Original: ولكن غادي نوريكم بلي ولد الإنسان عنده السلطة على الأرض باش يغفر الدنوب». وݣال للمشلول: «نوض هز فراشك وسير لدارك».
Original Translation: I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins."  Then he spoke to the man who could not walk. "Get up," he said. "Take your mat and go home."
Translated Sentence: But I will show you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins. " He said to the paralytic", Get up, take up your mat and go home".

Original: وناض الراجل ومشى لداره.
Original Translation: The man got up and went home.
Translated Sentence: He got up and walked towards her.

Original: وملي شافو جماعات الناس داكشي اللي جرا، خافو وعطاو العز لله اللي عطى للناس سلطة بحال هادي. يسوع كيختار متى
Original Translation: When the crowd saw this, they were filled with wonder. They praised God for giving that kind of authority to men. Jesus Chooses Matthew
Translated Sentence: When the crowds saw what had happened, they were filled with fear and gave glory to God, who had given such power to men.

Original: وملي كان يسوع غادي من تم، شاف واحد الراجل سميته متى ݣالس فدار الضريبة. وهو يݣول ليه: «تبعني». وناض تبعه.
Original Translation: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew. He was sitting at the tax collector's booth.  "Follow me," Jesus told him. Matthew got up and followed him.
Translated Sentence: As Jesus left, he saw a man sitting at the tax collector's office. "Follow me, " he said to him, and he stood up and followed him.

Original: ومن بعد ݣلس يسوع للماكلة فدار متى، وجاو عنده بزاف ديال مالين الضريبة والمدنبين وݣلسو معاه ومع تلامده. لوقا
Original Translation: Later Jesus was having dinner at Matthew's house. Many tax collectors and "sinners" came. They ate with Jesus and his disciples.
Translated Sentence: After Jesus had eaten at Matthew's house, many tax collectors and tax collectors came and sat down with him and his disciples.

Original: وملي شافوه الفريسيين، ݣالو لتلامده: «علاش المعلم ديالكم كياكل مع مالين الضريبة والمدنبين؟».
Original Translation: The Pharisees saw this. So they asked the disciples, "Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and 'sinners'?"
Translated Sentence: When the Pharisees saw him , they said to his disciples , " Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and tax collectors ? "

Original: وملي سمعهم يسوع جاوبهم وݣال: «راه المرضى اللي محتاجين للطبيب، ماشي اللي بصحتهم.
Original Translation: Jesus heard that. So he said, "Those who are healthy don't need a doctor. Sick people do.
Translated Sentence: Hearing this, Jesus said to them, "It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick.

Original: إيوا سيرو تعلمو المعنى ديال هاد الكلام: أنا راه بغيت الرحمة ماشي الدبيحة، حيت راني ما جيتش نعيط على اللي متاقيين الله، ولكن على المدنبين». السؤال على الصيام
Original Translation: Go and learn what this means, 'I want mercy and not sacrifice.' (Hosea 6:6) I have not come to get those who think they are right with God to follow me. I have come to get sinners to follow me." Jesus Is Asked About Fasting
Translated Sentence: They will know what this means: I want mercy, not sacrifice, for I have come to call not the righteous, but the wicked.

Original: ومن بعد جاو تلامد يوحنا المعمدان لعند يسوع وسولوه: «علاش حنا والفريسيين كنصومو بزاف، وتلامدك نت ما كيصوموش؟».
Original Translation: One day John's disciples came. They said to Jesus, "We and the Pharisees go without eating. Why don't your disciples go without eating?"
Translated Sentence: Then John's disciples came to Jesus and asked, "Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not?"

Original: وجاوبهم يسوع وݣال ليهم: «واش يقدرو المعروضين للعرس يحزنو والعريس معاهم؟ راه غادي يجي الوقت اللي غيتخاد العريس من بيناتهم وفديك الساعة غيصومو.
Original Translation: Jesus answered, "How can the guests of the groom be sad while he is with them? The time will come when the groom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast.
Translated Sentence: Jesus answered, "Can the guests of the bridegroom mourn while the bridegroom is with them? The time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will come to know him.

Original: حتى واحد ما كيرقع لباس قديم بطرف ديال التوب جديد، علاحقاش الرقعة غادي تكمش وتزيد التشريݣة تكبر.
Original Translation: "People don't sew a patch of new cloth on old clothes. The new piece will pull away from the old. That will make the tear worse.
Translated Sentence: Even if you put an old dress on the end of a new one , the patch will shrink and the strap will grow larger.

Original: وحتى واحد ما كيدير الخمر الجديد فݣربات ديال الجلد قدام، حيت إلا تدار فيهم غيتفرݣعو وهكا غيضيع الخمر ويتشرݣو الݣربات. ولكن كنديرو الخمر الجديد فݣربات ديال الجلد جداد، باش ما يضيع لا خمر ولا ݣربات». بنت الرئيس والمراة اللي مسات حوايج يسوع
Original Translation: "People don't pour new wine into old wineskins. If they do, the skins will burst. The wine will run out, and the wineskins will be destroyed. No, everyone pours new wine into new wineskins. Then both are saved." A Dead Girl and a Suffering Woman
Translated Sentence: No one drinks new wine in fresh skins, because if they are used, they will break up and the wine will spill and the skins will spill. But if they do, they will not waste wine or skins.

Original: وملي كان كيݣول ليهم هادشي، جا عنده واحد الرئيس وسجد ليه وݣال: «بنتي يالاه ماتت، ولكن أجي حط يدك عليها وغتحيا».
Original Translation: While Jesus was saying this, a ruler came. He got down on his knees in front of Jesus. He said, "My daughter has just died. But come and place your hand on her. Then she will live again."
Translated Sentence: When I told them this , there was a president who bowed down to him and said , "My daughter is dead, but I will come and lay your hand on her and live".

Original: وناض يسوع تبعه هو وتلامده.
Original Translation: Jesus got up and went with him. So did his disciples.
Translated Sentence: Jesus followed him with his disciples.

Original: وكانت تم واحد المراة مريضة، طناشر عام وهي كتدوز بالدم، قربات ورا يسوع ومسات جلايله،
Original Translation: Just then a woman came up behind Jesus. She had a sickness that made her bleed. It had lasted for 12 years. She touched the edge of his clothes.
Translated Sentence: And a woman was there who had been bleeding for twelve years. She followed Jesus with her six children.

Original: حيت ݣالت فخاطرها: «إلا مسيت غير حوايجه نتشافى».
Original Translation: She thought, "I only need to touch his clothes. Then I will be healed."
Translated Sentence: She thought, 'If I don't get it, I'll be fine.'

Original: وهو يتلفت يسوع وشافها وݣال: «تيقي آ بنتي، راه إيمانك شفاك». وفديك الساعة تشافات المراة.
Original Translation: Jesus turned and saw her. "Dear woman, don't give up hope," he said. "Your faith has healed you." The woman was healed at that very moment.
Translated Sentence: Jesus looked up and saw her. "Wake up, " he said", my daughter, your faith has made you well. " Now is the hour when the woman will be healed.

Original: وملي وصل يسوع لدار الرئيس وشاف اللي كينوحو بالليرة والجماعة د الناس دايرين الصداع،
Original Translation: When Jesus entered the ruler's house, he saw the flute players there. And he saw the noisy crowd.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus came to the president's house and saw the people mourning and the crowd of people suffering from headaches,

Original: ݣال ليهم: «خرجو من هنا! البنت ما ماتتش، راها غير ناعسة!»، وهم يضحكو عليه.
Original Translation: He said, "Go away. The girl is not dead. She is sleeping." But they laughed at him.
Translated Sentence: "Get out of here! " he said. " The girl is not dead, she is not asleep". They laughed at him.

Original: وملي خرجهم يسوع برا، دخل وشد البنت من يدها وهي تنوض.
Original Translation: After the crowd had been sent outside, Jesus went in. He took the girl by the hand, and she got up.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus took them outside , he entered and took the girl by the hand and she got up .

Original: وداعت الخبار فديك الجوايه كلها. يسوع كيشافي جوج د العميين
Original Translation: News about what Jesus had done spread all over that area. Jesus Heals Two Blind Men
Translated Sentence: The news has spread throughout the world. Jesus heals two blind men

Original: وملي كان يسوع دايز من تم، تبعوه جوج د العميين كيغوتو وكيݣولو: «رحمنا آ بن داود!».
Original Translation: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him. They called out, "Have mercy on us, Son of David!"
Translated Sentence: As Jesus was rising, two blind men followed him, shouting, "Have mercy on us, Son of David!"

Original: وملي دخل للدار، قربو لعنده العميين. وهو يسولهم يسوع: «واش كتآمنو بلي أنا قادر نشفيكم؟»، وجاوبوه: «إيه آ سيدي!».
Original Translation: When Jesus went indoors, the blind men came to him. He asked them, "Do you believe that I can do this?"  "Yes, Lord," they replied.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus entered the house, the blind men came to him. "Do you believe that I can do this? " Jesus asked them". Yes, Lord, " they replied.

Original: وديك الساعة مس يسوع عينيهم وݣال: «على قد إيمانكم غادي يكون ليكم داكشي اللي بغيتو».
Original Translation: Then he touched their eyes. He said, "It will happen to you just as you believed."
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus looked at them and said, "According to your faith, it will be done for you".

Original: وهم يتحلو ليهم عينيهم، ونهاهم يسوع وݣال: «عنداكم تݣولوها لشي حد!».
Original Translation: They could now see again. Jesus strongly warned them, "Be sure that no one knows about this."
Translated Sentence: They opened their eyes, and Jesus said to them, "So tell it to someone else".

Original: ولكن هم خرجو وبداو كيديعو الخبار فديك الجوايه كلها. زيزون كيتشافى
Original Translation: But they went out and spread the news. They talked about him all over that area.
Translated Sentence: But they came out and started spreading the news all over the place .

Original: وما جاو فين يخرجو العميين، حتى جابو ليه واحد الراجل زيزون ومسكون بالجنون.
Original Translation: While they were going out, another man was brought to Jesus. A demon controlled him, and he could not speak.
Translated Sentence: They didn't even come out to take the blind out, until they brought him a man who was crazy and crazy.

Original: وملي خرج يسوع الجن، هضر الزيزون. وهم يتعجبو الجماعات د الناس وݣالو: «عمرنا ما شفنا بحال هادشي فإسرائيل!».
Original Translation: When the demon was driven out, the man spoke.  The crowd was amazed. They said, "Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel."
Translated Sentence: When Jesus had driven out the demons, he hurled at the Zephaniah. The crowds were amazed and said, "We have never seen anything like this in Israel".

Original: أما الفريسيين ݣالو: «راه كيخرج الجنون برئيس الجنون!». متى 10‏:25؛ 12‏:24؛ مرقس 3‏:22؛ لوقا 11‏:15 المحنة ديال يسوع
Original Translation: But the Pharisees said, "He drives out demons by the power of the prince of demons." There Are Only a Few Workers
Translated Sentence: But the Pharisees said, "He drives out the madman by the head of the madman".

Original: وكان يسوع كيمشي لݣاع المدون والدواور كيعلم فديور الصلاة ديالهم وكيخبر بالبشارة ديال مملكة الله، وكيشافي كل علة وكل مرض. متى
Original Translation: Jesus went through all the towns and villages. He taught in their synagogues. He preached the good news of the kingdom. And he healed every illness and sickness.
Translated Sentence: Jesus went about in every village, teaching the people about prayer, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every sickness.

Original: وملي شاف الجماعات د الناس، حن عليهم حيت كانو معدبين ومشتتين بحال الغنم اللي ما عندها سراح. مرقس
Original Translation: When he saw the crowds, he felt deep concern for them. They were beaten down and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
Translated Sentence: When I saw these crowds of people, I felt sorry for them because they were scattered and scattered like sheep without a release.

Original: وهو يݣول لتلامده: «الحصاد كتير، ولكن الحصادا قلال. لوقا
Original Translation: Then Jesus said to his disciples, "The harvest is huge. But there are only a few workers.
Translated Sentence: Then he said to his disciples, "The harvest is plentiful, but the harvest is few.

Original: إيوا طلبو من مول الحصاد باش يصيفط الحصادا للحصاد دياله».
Original Translation: So ask the Lord of the harvest to send workers out into his harvest field."
Translated Sentence: Ask the harvesting company to send the harvest to its harvest.

Original: الفصل العاشر يسوع كيصيفط تلامده الطناش
Original Translation: Jesus Sends Out the Twelve Disciples
Translated Sentence: Chapter ten Jesus sends out his twelve disciples

Original: ومن بعد عيط يسوع على تلامده الطناش وعطاهم السلطة باش يخرجو الجنون ويشافيو الناس من كل علة ومن كل مرض.
Original Translation: Jesus called for his 12 disciples to come to him. He gave them authority to drive out evil spirits and to heal every illness and sickness.
Translated Sentence: Jesus called the twelve disciples to him and gave them authority to drive out demons and to heal people of every kind of sickness and every disease.

Original: وهادو هم السميات ديال الرسل الطناش: اللول فيهم سمعان المكني بطرس وخوه أندراوس، ويعقوب بن زبدي ويوحنا خوه،
Original Translation: Here are the names of the 12 apostles. First are Simon Peter and his brother Andrew. Then come James, son of Zebedee, and his brother John.
Translated Sentence: These are the names of the twelve apostles: First, Simon the Magus and his brother Andrew, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother,

Original: وفيلبس وبرتولماوس، وتوما، ومتى مول الضريبة، ويعقوب بن حلفى وتداوس،
Original Translation: Next are Philip and Bartholomew, and also Thomas and Matthew the tax collector. Two more are James, son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus.
Translated Sentence: and Philip, and Ptolemy, and Thoma, and the tax collector, and Jacob the son of Hephaeus, and Daus,

Original: وسمعان الوطني، ويهودا الإسخريوطي اللي غيخون يسوع.
Original Translation: The last are Simon the Zealot and Judas Iscariot. Judas is the one who was later going to hand Jesus over to his enemies.
Translated Sentence: He was a patriot, and Judas Iscariot who betrayed Jesus.

Original: وصيفط يسوع هاد الطناش ووصاهم وݣال: «ما تمشيوش لعند الشعوب اللي ماشي يهود وما تدخلوش لمدون السامريين،
Original Translation: Jesus sent these 12 out with the following orders. "Do not go among those who aren't Jews," he said. "Do not enter any town of the Samaritans.
Translated Sentence: These twelve Jesus sent out, commanding them, "Do not go to the Gentiles, nor enter any country of Samaritans.

Original: ولكن سيرو لعند الخرفان الموضرين اللي من شعب إسرائيل،
Original Translation: Instead, go to the people of Israel. They are like sheep that have become lost.
Translated Sentence: But they will go to the lost sheep of the people of Israel,

Original: وفطريقكم خبرو الناس بلي الوقت ديال مملكة السماوات راه قرب.
Original Translation: As you go, preach this message, 'The kingdom of heaven is near.'
Translated Sentence: And your way tell people that the time for the kingdom of heaven is near.

Original: شفيو المرضى، وحييو الموتى، وردو المجدامين طاهرين، وخرجو الجنون. خديتو بلاش إيوا عطيو بلاش.
Original Translation: Heal those who are sick. Bring those who are dead back to life. Make those who have skin diseases 'clean' again. Drive out demons. You have received freely, so give freely.
Translated Sentence: They healed the sick, they healed the dead, they made the dead clean, they drove mad. They gave it away for nothing.

Original: ما تديو فجيوبكم لا دهب، لا فضة، لا نحاس،
Original Translation: "Do not take along any gold, silver or copper in your belts.
Translated Sentence: You must carry no gold , no silver , no copper in your pockets .

Original: لا رزمة، لا جوج لبسات، لا صباط، لا عكاز، علاحقاش الخدام كيستاهل ماكلته. 1كورنتوس 9‏:14؛ 1تيموتاوس 5‏:18
Original Translation: Do not take a bag for the journey. Do not take extra clothes or sandals or walking sticks. A worker should be given what he needs.
Translated Sentence: No bag, no two coats, no shoes, no clubs, for any service is worthy of me.

Original: والمدينة ولا الدوار اللي دخلتو ليهم، سولو على شي حد يستاهل يضايفكم، وبقاو عنده حتى تمشيو بحالكم.
Original Translation: "When you enter a town or village, look for someone who is willing to welcome you. Stay at that person's house until you leave.
Translated Sentence: The city or the tourist area you are in will be welcomed by someone worthy of your hospitality and will remain with you until you leave.

Original: وإلا دخلتو لشي دار، سلمو على ماليها.
Original Translation: As you enter the home, greet those who live there.
Translated Sentence: When you enter a house , give it to her.

Original: وإلا كانو مالين الدار يستاهلو سلامكم، سلامكم يوصل ليهم. وإلا ما كانوش يستاهلوه، سلامكم يرجع ليكم.
Original Translation: If that home welcomes you, give it your blessing of peace. If it does not, don't bless it.
Translated Sentence: If the household is worthy of your peace , your peace will come to them; if it is not, your peace will return to you .

Original: وإلا ما قبلوكمش مالين شي دار ولا شي مدينة ولا ما سمعوش لكلامكم، خرجو من تم وسوسو الغبرة اللي فرجليكم. الاعمال

Original Translation: His disciples answered him. "There is nothing here," they said. "Where could we get enough bread to feed this large crowd?"
Translated Sentence: And they said to him , " Where shall we get this bread that can satisfy such a large crowd ? "

Original: وݣال ليهم يسوع: «شحال من خبزة عندكم؟»، وجاوبوه: «سبعة د الخبزات وشي حوتات صغار».
Original Translation: "How many loaves do you have?" Jesus asked.  "Seven," they replied, "and a few small fish."
Translated Sentence: "How many loaves do you have? " Jesus asked". Seven, " they replied, "and a few small fish".

Original: وآمر يسوع الجماعة د الناس باش يݣلسو للأرض،
Original Translation: Jesus told the crowd to sit down on the ground.
Translated Sentence: Jesus ordered the crowd to sit down on the ground.

Original: وخدا هادوك سبعة د الخبزات والحوتات، وشكر الله وقطعهم وعطى لتلامده، وتلامده عطاو للجماعات د الناس.
Original Translation: He took the seven loaves and the fish and gave thanks. Then he broke them and gave them to the disciples. And the disciples passed them out to the people.
Translated Sentence: Then he took the seven loaves and the fish, gave thanks, broke them and gave them to his disciples, who distributed them to the people.

Original: وكلاو كلهم حتى شبعو، وهزو سبعة د الݣفات عامرين بالطروف د الخبز اللي شاطو.
Original Translation: All of them ate and were satisfied. After that, the disciples picked up seven baskets of leftover pieces.
Translated Sentence: They were all full, and there were seven loaves of bread on the beach.

Original: وكانو الناس اللي كلاو ربعالاف واحد من غير العيالات والولاد.
Original Translation: The number of men who ate was 4,000. Women and children also ate.
Translated Sentence: There were fourteen thousand people without wives and children.

Original: وملي صيفط يسوع الجماعات د الناس، ركب فالفلوكة وجا لجوايه بلاد مجدان.
Original Translation: After Jesus had sent the crowd away, he got into the boat. He went to the area near Magadan.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus sent these crowds, he boarded a boat and went to two different countries.

Original: الفصل سطاش علامات الزمان
Original Translation: Jesus Is Asked for a Miraculous Sign
Translated Sentence: Chapter sixteen is a time sign

Original: وجاو لعند يسوع شي وحدين من الفريسيين والصدوقيين باش يجربوه، وطلبو منه يبين ليهم شي علامة من السما. متى
Original Translation: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to put Jesus to the test. They asked him to show them a miraculous sign from heaven.
Translated Sentence: Some Pharisees and Sadducees came to Jesus to test him. They asked him to show them a sign from heaven.

Original: ولكن هو جاوبهم وݣال: «ملي كتغرب الشمس كتݣولو: الجو غيكون صافي، علاحقاش السما حمرا.
Original Translation: He replied, "In the evening you look at the sky. You say, 'It will be good weather. The sky is red.'
Translated Sentence: But he answered them, "When the sun sets, you say, 'It will be clear, because the sky is red.'

Original: وفالصباح بكري كتݣولو: اليوم غادي تكون الشتا، علاحقاش السما حمرا ومضببة. كتعرفو تفسرو حالة الجو، ولكن علامات الزمان ما كتقدروش تفسروهم!
Original Translation: And in the morning you say, 'Today it will be stormy. The sky is red and cloudy.' You know the meaning of what you see in the sky. But you can't understand the signs of what is happening right now.
Translated Sentence: And in the morning they say: 'It will be cold today, because the sky is red and wet.' You can explain the weather, but the weather signs can't explain them!

Original: جيل قبيح وفاسد كيطلب علامة، وما غادي تعطاه حتى شي علامة من غير علامة يونان». ومن بعد خلاهم يسوع ومشى. متى 12‏:39؛ لوقا 11‏:29 خميرة الفريسيين والصدوقيين
Original Translation: An evil and unfaithful people look for a miraculous sign. But none will be given to them except the sign of Jonah."  Then Jesus left them and went away. The Yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees
Translated Sentence: An ugly and corrupt generation seeks a sign, and no sign will be given it except the sign of the Greeks. From then on Jesus left them and walked away.

Original: وملي وصلو التلامد للجهة لخرى من البحر، نساو ياخدو معاهم الخبز.
Original Translation: The disciples crossed over to the other side of the lake. They had forgotten to take bread.
Translated Sentence: When the students reached the other side of the sea, they forgot to take bread with them.

Original: وݣال ليهم يسوع: «ردو البال، حضيو راسكم من خميرة الفريسيين والصدوقيين!». لوقا
Original Translation: "Be careful," Jesus said to them. "Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."
Translated Sentence: Jesus said to them, "Watch out, be on your guard against the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees".

Original: وهم يݣولو مع راسهم: «كيݣول لينا هاد الكلام علاحقاش ما خديناش معانا الخبز».
Original Translation: The disciples talked about this among themselves. They said, "He must be saying this because we didn't bring any bread."
Translated Sentence: They discussed this among themselves, saying, "It is because we have not taken bread".

Original: وعرف يسوع فاش كيفكرو وݣال ليهم: «علاش آ قلالين الإيمان كتݣولو فخاطركم: ما عندنا خبز؟
Original Translation: Jesus knew what they were saying. So he said, "Your faith is so small! Why are you talking to each other about having no bread?
Translated Sentence: Jesus knew their thoughts and asked, "You of little faith, why do you reason among yourselves that you have no bread?

Original: واش مازال ما فهمتو؟ واش ما عقلتوش على خمسة د الخبزات اللي تفرقو على خمسالاف واحد، وشحال من ݣفة جمعتو من الطروف د الخبز؟ متى
Original Translation: Don't you understand yet? Don't you remember the five loaves for the 5,000? Don't you remember how many baskets of pieces you gathered?
Translated Sentence: Have you not yet understood ? Have you not thought of five loaves of bread divided by five thousand and how many loaves of bread have you collected ?

Original: وما عقلتوش على سبعة د الخبزات اللي تفرقو على ربعالاف واحد وشحال من ݣفة جمعتو؟ متى
Original Translation: Don't you remember the seven loaves for the 4,000? Don't you remember how many baskets of pieces you gathered?
Translated Sentence: What do you think of the seven loaves of bread divided into a quarter of a thousand and how many loaves have you collected ?

Original: كيفاش ما قدرتوش تفهمو بلي أنا ما كنتش كنقصد بكلامي ليكم الخبز؟ حضيو راسكم من خميرة الفريسيين والصدوقيين!».
Original Translation: How can you possibly not understand? I wasn't talking to you about bread. But watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."
Translated Sentence: How could you not understand that I did not mean bread? Get your heads out of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees!

Original: وديك الساعة، عاد فهمو تلامده بلي ݣال ليهم يحضيو راسهم من تعليم الفريسيين والصدوقيين، ماشي من خميرة الخبز. بطرس كيشهد بلي يسوع هو المسيح
Original Translation: Then the disciples understood that Jesus was not telling them to watch out for the yeast used in bread. He was warning them against what the Pharisees and Sadducees taught. Peter Says That Jesus Is the Christ
Translated Sentence: About that time, they understood that he had told them to be careful not to eat the yeast of bread, but to be careful of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees. Peter testified that Jesus was the Christ.

Original: وملي وصل يسوع لجوايه قيصرية فيلبس، سول تلامده: «شكون هو ولد الإنسان فنضر الناس؟»
Original Translation: Jesus went to the area of Caesarea Philippi. There he asked his disciples, "Who do people say the Son of Man is?"
Translated Sentence: When Jesus came to the palace of Caesarea Philip, his disciples asked him, "Who is the Son of Man and who is he to judge people?"

Original: وهم يجاوبوه: «شي منهم كيݣول: يوحنا المعمدان، وشي كيݣول: النبي إيليا، ووحدين خرين كيݣولو: النبي إرميا ولا شي واحد من الأنبيا». متى
Original Translation: They replied, "Some say John the Baptist. Others say Elijah. Still others say Jeremiah, or one of the prophets."
Translated Sentence: They replied, "Some say that you are John the Baptist, others that you are Elijah, and still others that you are Jeremiah or one of the prophets".

Original: وسولهم: «ونتم شكون أنا فنضركم؟».
Original Translation: "But what about you?" he asked. "Who do you say I am?"
Translated Sentence: "Who do you want me to bring to you?" they asked.

Original: وجاوب سمعان بطرس وݣال: «نت هو المسيح ولد الله الحي!»، يوحنا
Original Translation: Simon Peter answered, "You are the Christ. You are the Son of the living God."
Translated Sentence: Simon Peter answered, "You are the Christ, the Son of the living God".

Original: وݣال ليه يسوع: «سعداتك آ سمعان بن يونا! علاحقاش ماشي شي بنادم اللي وراك هاد الحقيقة، ولكن با اللي فالسماوات هو اللي وراها ليك.
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "Blessed are you, Simon, son of Jonah! No mere man showed this to you. My Father in heaven showed it to you.
Translated Sentence: Jesus said to him, "Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah! No one in the world has seen you this way, but only the Father in heaven has seen you.

Original: وأنا راني نݣول ليك: نت بطرس، وعلى هاد الصخرة غادي نبني كنيستي، وقوة الموت ما غتقدرش عليها.
Original Translation: Here is what I tell you. You are Peter. On this rock I will build my church. The gates of hell will not be strong enough to destroy it.
Translated Sentence: And I tell you , I am Peter , and on this rock I will build my church; the powers of the dead will not prevail against it .

Original: وغنعطيك سوارت مملكة السماوات، كل حاجة غتربطها فالأرض غادي تكون مربوطة فالسماوات، وكل حاجة غتحلها فالأرض غادي تكون محلولة فالسماوات». متى
Original Translation: I will give you the keys to the kingdom of heaven. What you lock on earth will be locked in heaven. What you unlock on earth will be unlocked in heaven."
Translated Sentence: And I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you untie on earth will be untyed in heaven.

Original: ومن بعد وصى يسوع تلامده باش ما يݣولو لحتى شي حد بلي هو المسيح. يسوع كيتنبأ بالموت والبعت دياله
Original Translation: Then Jesus warned his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ. Jesus Tells About His Coming Death
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus ordered his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ.

Original: ومن ديك الساعة، بدا يسوع كيبين لتلامده بلي خاصه يمشي لأورشليم ويتعدب بزاف على يد الشيوخ والرؤسا د رجال الدين والعلما د الشرع، وخاصه يتقتل، وفاليوم التالت غيتبعت من الموت.
Original Translation: From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples what would happen to him. He told them he must go to Jerusalem. There he must suffer many things from the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law. He must be killed and on the third day rise to life again.
Translated Sentence: From that time on, Jesus appeared to his disciples that he was going to Jerusalem and be greatly persecuted by the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and that he would be killed and on the third day be raised to life.

Original: وجره بطرس للجنب وبدا كيخاصم عليه وكيݣول: «حاشا آ سيدي باش يطرا ليك هادشي!»،
Original Translation: Peter took Jesus to one side and began to scold him. "Never, Lord!" he said. "This will never happen to you!"
Translated Sentence: Peter took him aside and began to speak out against him. "Surely not, Lord, " he said".

Original: وهو يتلفت وݣال لبطرس: «بعد مني آ هاد الشيطان! نت راك سباب عترة لي، علاحقاش كتفكر فأمور الناس ماشي فأمور الله».
Original Translation: Jesus turned and said to Peter, "Get behind me, Satan! You are standing in my way. You do not have in mind the things of God. Instead, you are thinking about human things."
Translated Sentence: But Jesus turned and said to Peter, "Get behind me, Satan! I see you are troubled, for you do not think God's thoughts but those of men".

Original: وهو يݣول يسوع لتلامده: «إلا بغا شي واحد يتبعني، خاصه يسمح فراسه ويهز الصليب دياله ويتبعني، متى
Original Translation: Then Jesus spoke to his disciples. He said, "If anyone wants to follow me, he must say no to himself. He must pick up his cross and follow me.
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus said to his disciples, "If anyone wants to follow me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

Original: علاحقاش اللي بغا ينجي حياته غيضيعها، ولكن اللي ضيع حياته على قبلي غيلقاها. متى
Original Translation: If he wants to save his life, he will lose it. But if he loses his life for me, he will find it.
Translated Sentence: For those who want to save their lives will lose them , but those who lose their lives before me will lose them .

Original: آش من نفع عند بنادم إلا ربح الدنيا كلها وضيع حياته؟ ولا آش غادي يعطي بنادم فعوض حياته؟
Original Translation: "What good is it if someone gains the whole world but loses his soul? Or what can anyone trade for his soul?
Translated Sentence: What good is it for a man to gain but the whole world and his life ? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life ?

Original: راه غادي يجي ولد الإنسان مع الملايكة دياله فعز باه وغيجازي كل واحد على حساب الأعمال دياله. متى
Original Translation: The Son of Man is going to come in his Father's glory. His angels will come with him. And he will reward everyone in keeping with what they have done.
Translated Sentence: The Son of Man will come with his angel and reward him and his angels, each according to his own deeds. When?

Original: ونݣول ليكم الحق: راه كاين فالحاضرين هنا اللي ما غيموتو حتى يشوفو ولد الإنسان جاي فمملكته».
Original Translation: "What I'm about to tell you is true. Some who are standing here will not die before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom."
Translated Sentence: I tell you the truth, some of those standing here will not taste death until they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom".

Original: الفصل سبعطاش يسوع كيبان فالعز دياله
Original Translation: Jesus' Appearance Is Changed
Translated Sentence: Chapter seventeen Jesus appears in his glory

Original: ومن بعد ست يام، دا يسوع بطرس ويعقوب وخوه يوحنا، وطلعهم بوحدهم لواحد الجبل عالي.
Original Translation: After six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John the brother of James with him. He led them up a high mountain. They were all alone.
Translated Sentence: Six days later Jesus took Peter and James and John's brother and led them up a high mountain by themselves.

Original: وتبدل الشكل دياله قدامهم، وضوا وجهه كالشمس، وحوايجه ولاو بويض كيلمعو كالنور.
Original Translation: There in front of them his appearance was changed. His face shone like the sun. His clothes became as white as the light.
Translated Sentence: His form changed before them, his face was as bright as the sun, and his hair and his eyes were as white as light.

Original: وهو يبان ليهم موسى وإيليا كيتكلمو مع يسوع.
Original Translation: Just then Moses and Elijah appeared in front of them. Moses and Elijah were talking with Jesus.
Translated Sentence: It seemed that Moses and Elijah were talking with Jesus.

Original: وݣال بطرس ليسوع: «شحال مزيان نبقاو هنا آ سيدي. إلا بغيتي، نصايب هنا تلاتة د النوايل، وحدة ليك ووحدة لموسى ووحدة لإيليا».
Original Translation: Peter said to Jesus, "Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters. One will be for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
Translated Sentence: "Sir, " Peter replied", it is good for us to be here. If you want me to, I will put three tabernacles here, one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah".

Original: وفالوقت فاش كان كيتكلم ضللات عليهم واحد السحابة مضوية، وتكلم صوت من السحابة وݣال: «هادا هو ولدي العزيز اللي بيه فرحت بزاف، سمعو ليه!». 2بطرس 1‏:17‏،18
Original Translation: While Peter was still speaking, a bright cloud surrounded them. A voice from the cloud said, "This is my Son, and I love him. I am very pleased with him. Listen to him!"
Translated Sentence: While he was speaking, a bright cloud appeared and a voice came from the cloud: "This is my Son, whom I love, with whom I am well pleased. Listen to him".

Original: وملي سمعو التلامد هادشي، طاحو على وجوههم وخافو بزاف.
Original Translation: When the disciples heard this, they were terrified. They fell with their faces to the ground.
Translated Sentence: When the students heard this, they fell on their faces and were terrified.

Original: وقرب يسوع لعندهم ومسهم وݣال ليهم: «نوضو، ما تخافوش!».
Original Translation: But Jesus came and touched them. "Get up," he said. "Don't be afraid."
Translated Sentence: But Jesus came and touched them and said, "Get up, do not be afraid".

Original: وهزو عينيهم وشافو غير يسوع بوحده.
Original Translation: When they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus.
Translated Sentence: They lifted their eyes and saw no one but Jesus.

Original: وفالوقت فاش كانو نازلين من الجبل، وصاهم يسوع وݣال: «ما تݣولو لحتى شي حد هادشي اللي شفتو حتى يتبعت ولد الإنسان من الموت».
Original Translation: They came down the mountain. On the way down, Jesus told them what to do. "Don't tell anyone what you have seen," he said. "Wait until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead."
Translated Sentence: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus looked at them and said, "Do not tell anyone what you have seen until the Son of Man has risen from the dead".

Original: وسولوه تلامده: «إيوا علاش كيݣولو العلما د الشرع بلي فاللول خاص النبي إيليا يجي؟».
Original Translation: The disciples asked him, "Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah has to come first?"
Translated Sentence: His disciples asked him, "Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must first come?"

Original: وجاوبهم وݣال: «فالحقيقة، إيليا غيجي هو اللول وغيصلح كلشي،
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "That's right. Elijah is supposed to come and make all things new again.
Translated Sentence: Jesus answered them, "Actually, Elijah must come first and restore all things.

Original: ولكن نݣول ليكم: راه جا إيليا وما عرفوهش، ودارو بيه ما بغاو، وهكا ولد الإنسان حتى هو غادي يتعدب على يديهم». متى
Original Translation: But I tell you, Elijah has already come. People didn't recognize him. They have done to him everything they wanted to do. In the same way, they are going to make the Son of Man suffer."
Translated Sentence: But I tell you, Elijah has already come, and they did not know him, but they turned him into what they wanted. So also the Son of Man is going to be betrayed by them".

Original: وديك الساعة فهمو التلامد بلي كان كيتكلم ليهم على يوحنا المعمدان. يسوع كيشافي ولد مسكون
Original Translation: Then the disciples understood that Jesus was talking to them about John the Baptist. Jesus Heals a Boy Who Had a Demon
Translated Sentence: At that moment the disciples understood that he was speaking to them about John the Baptist. Jesus healed a demon-possessed boy.

Original: وملي وصل يسوع والتلامد دياله لعند الجماعة د الناس، جا لعنده واحد الراجل وسجد ليه،
Original Translation: When they came near the crowd, a man approached Jesus. He got on his knees in front of him.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus and his disciples came to the crowd, a man came to him and worshiped him.

Original: وݣال: «رحم ولدي آ سيدي، علاحقاش فيه لرياح وكيتعدب بزاف، وبزاف د المرات كيطيح فالعافية وفالما.
Original Translation: "Lord," he said, "have mercy on my son. He shakes wildly and suffers a great deal. He often falls into the fire or into the water.
Translated Sentence: "He said,' Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is suffering from a fever and is very ill, and often falls into a coma. '

Original: وجبته لتلامدك وما قدروش يشافيوه».
Original Translation: I brought him to your disciples. But they couldn't heal him."
Translated Sentence: It was for your students and they couldn't cure it.

Original: وجاوب يسوع وݣال: «آ هاد الجيل اللي ما عنده إيمان! حتى لإمتى غنبقى معاكم؟ حتى لإمتى غنتحملكم؟ جيبو لي الولد لهنا!».
Original Translation: "You unbelieving and evil people!" Jesus replied. "How long do I have to stay with you? How long do I have to put up with you? Bring the boy here to me."
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "You unbelieving generation! How long shall I be with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring him here".

Original: ونهض يسوع فالجن، وهو يخرج من الولد، وتشافى ديك الساعة.
Original Translation: Jesus ordered the demon to leave the boy, and it came out of him. He was healed at that very moment.
Translated Sentence: Jesus got up and came out of the boy, and he was healed at that hour.

Original: وقربو التلامد ليسوع وسولوه غير بينهم وبينه وݣالو: «علاش ما قدرناش حنا نخرجو الجن؟».
Original Translation: Then the disciples came to Jesus in private. They asked, "Why couldn't we drive out the demon?"
Translated Sentence: The disciples came to Jesus and asked him privately, "Why couldn't we drive out the demon?"

Original: وݣال ليهم: «بسباب قلة إيمانكم! ونݣول ليكم الحق: إلا كان عندكم إيمان قد حبة الخردل، غادي تݣولو لهاد الجبل: تحول من هنا لهيه، وغادي يتحول. وحتى شي حاجة ما غتكون محال عندكم. [
Original Translation: He replied, "Because your faith is much too small. What I'm about to tell you is true. If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, it is enough. You can say to this mountain, 'Move from here to there.' And it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you."
Translated Sentence: He replied, "Because of your lack of faith. I tell you the truth, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain,' Move from here to there, 'and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you".

Original: وهاد النوع د الجنون ما كيخرج غير بالصلاة والصيام».] # 17‏.21 هاد الآية ما كايناش فبزاف ديال المخطوطات القدام متى 21‏:21؛ مرقس 11‏:23؛ 1كورنتوس 13‏:2 يسوع كيتنبأ مرة خرى بالموت والبعت دياله
Translated Sentence: This kind of madness is not released except by prayer and fasting.] # 17 .21 This verse is not found in many ancient manuscripts Matthew 21:21; Mark 11:23; 1 Corinthians 13:2

Original: وكانو التلامد مجموعين فبلاد الجليل، وهو يݣول ليهم يسوع: «ولد الإنسان غيتسلم لليدين د الناس،
Original Translation: They came together in Galilee. Then Jesus said to them, "The Son of Man is going to be handed over to men.
Translated Sentence: While his disciples were together in Galilee, Jesus said to them, "The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of these men.

Original: وغيقتلوه، وفالنهار التالت غيتبعت». وحزنو التلامد بزاف. يسوع كيخلص الضريبة ديال بيت الله
Original Translation: They will kill him. On the third day he will rise from the dead."  Then the disciples were filled with deep sadness. Jesus Pays the Temple Tax
Translated Sentence: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be executed. And the disciples will be very sad. Jesus pays the tax on the temple.

Original: وملي رجع يسوع وتلامده لكفرناحوم، جاو مالين الضريبة ديال بيت الله عند بطرس وسولوه: «واش ما كيخلصش المعلم ديالكم الضريبة ديال بيت الله؟».
Original Translation: Jesus and his disciples arrived in Capernaum. There the tax collectors came to Peter. They asked him, "Doesn't your teacher pay the temple tax?"
Translated Sentence: When Jesus and his disciples returned to Capernaum, tax collectors came to Peter and asked him, "Does your teacher pay the tax?"

Original: وجاوبهم: «إيه، راه كيخلصها». وملي دخل للدار سبقه يسوع وݣال ليه: «آش بان ليك آ سمعان؟ من عند من كياخدو ملوك الأرض الضريبة ولا الجزية؟ واش من ولادهم ولا من البراني؟».
Original Translation: "Yes, he does," he replied.  When Peter came into the house, Jesus spoke first. "What do you think, Simon?" he asked. "Who do the kings of the earth collect taxes and fees from? Do they collect from their own sons or from others?"
Translated Sentence: "Yes, " he replied". When he came into the house, Jesus went ahead and asked him", What do you want, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth collect taxes or tribute? From their own people or from strangers?"

Original: وجاوبه بطرس: «من البراني». وهو يݣول يسوع: «على هادشي ولادهم راهم معفيين من الضريبة.
Original Translation: "From others," Peter answered.  "Then the sons don't have to pay," Jesus said to him.
Translated Sentence: "The farmer, " Peter replied". The farmer, " Jesus said", The children of this generation are exempt.

Original: ولكن باش ما نتسببوش ليهم فشي مشكل، سير للبحر ورمي الصنارة، والحوتة اللولى اللي غتشدها، حل ليها فمها، وغادي تلقا فيه ربعة ديال الدراهم، خدها وسير خلص عليك وعلي».
Original Translation: "But we don't want to make them angry. So go to the lake and throw out your fishing line. Take the first fish you catch. Open its mouth. There you will find the exact coin you need. Take it and give it to them for my tax and yours."
Translated Sentence: But to avoid causing them any trouble , go to the sea and throw a shark , and the first whale that catches it , open its mouth , and if you find a quarter of their silver, take it and it will kill you and me.
